intro: Psychotria cinerea, commonly known as the ghost plant, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its dark green, leathery leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It is often found in shaded, humid environments such as rainforests. Psychotria cinerea is also known for its chemical complexity, producing various alkaloids that have been studied for their potential pharmacological properties.
